item.title: Amanda Visconti on "Does anyone have resources or examples on how to write about website design?"
item.dc:creator: Amanda Visconti
item.description:
Replying to @mlholloway251's post:

If you're not already involved there, it could also be useful to join HASTAC and blog about your process/questions that come upâ€”there's a pretty good community of commenters there.

item.title: Amanda Visconti on "Does anyone have resources or examples on how to write about website design?"
item.dc:creator: Amanda Visconti
item.description:
Some of the pieces of my (completed) digital dissertation using web design/development for literature scholarship might be useful? Some specific links below, but also check out this great GoogleDoc some folks at CUNY curated with info on a variety of digital dissertation formats.

I have some blog posts both about the design of a digital edition website for my dissertation, and about the design of the websites presenting the dissertation (e.g. post on choosing and arguing for digital dissertation design, and some design choices, and user testing dissertation websites).

A skim of the table of contents for the whitepaper debriefing my digital dissertation might also be useful?

I also found it useful to make a list of all the scholarly effort that went into the digital dissertation, annotated to explain the website-related work that might not be obvious to scholarly evaluators.

item.title: mlholloway251 on "Does anyone have resources or examples on how to write about website design?"
item.dc:creator: mlholloway251
item.description: I am creating a website via wordpress for my dissertation and I need help on how to write about design choices, layout, what I chose to include, etc. If you have any resources that might help me please let me know. Thanks!
